item.title: Roberta add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Make it a rule never to give a child a book you would not read yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "There are years that ask questions and years that answer." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Richard Fortey
item.description: "You must not lie about trilobites, nor yet about time." -- Richard Fortey

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Thomas à Kempis
item.description: "Wherever you go, there you are." -- Thomas à Kempis

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "There is a crack in everything. That's how the light gets in." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Cesar Millan
item.description: "I believe in integrity. Dogs have it. Humans are sometimes lacking it." -- Cesar Millan

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Greg Mortenson
item.description: "You can hand out condoms, drop bombs, build roads, or put in electricity, but until the girls are educated a society won’t change." -- Greg Mortenson

item.title: Roberta add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him." -- Voltaire

item.title: Roberta add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Roberta add a quote by Colin Powell
Roberta add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "On the highest throne in the world, we still sit only on our own bottom." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Roberta add a quote by John Rogers
item.description:
"There are two novels that can change a bookish fourteen-year old’s life: <i>[book:The Lord of the Rings|10254806]</i> and <i>[book:Atlas Shrugged|9365]</i>. One is a childish fantasy that often engenders a lifelong obsession with its unbelievable heroes, leading to an emotionally stunted, socially crippled adulthood, unable to deal with the real world. The other, of course, involves orcs."
[<i>Kung Fu Monkey -- Ephemera</i>, blog post, March 19, 2009]" -- John Rogers
